required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a Smartphone-based Intelligent Diagnosis and Measurement for Strabismus
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a Smartphone-based Intelligent Diagnosis and Measurement for Strabismus

brief_summary.textblock: The current measurement methods of strabismus include the corneal light reflection method, prism alternate covering, etc., which especially rely on the subjective experience of doctors, and there is a large error between different measurersï¼Œ leading to serious underestimation of strabismus prevalence and insufficient care for strabismus patients. Here, the investigators established and validated an artificial intelligence system to achieve an automatic diagnosis of strabismus based on patient-sourced videos of programmatic cover tests. Three-dimensional reconstruction methods are used to digitize the parameters of head and eye positions. This system has been integrated into a smartphone platform to be further validated through hospital-based and population-based clinical trials.

primary_outcome.description: The accurate and the area under curve of the smartphone-based diagnosis.

primary_outcome.measure: The consistency between manual and smartphone measurement
primary_outcome.description: Agreement between the manual and automated tests was represented in Bland-Altman plots and concordance correlation coefficients.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Eligible participants for smartphone-based strabismus measurement and diagnosis
arm_group.description: Facial videos dataset Facial videos were collected using smartphone and following the programmatic cover tests.

intervention.intervention_name: A new technology based on 3D reconstruction and deep learning algorithm to achieve an automatic diagnosis of strabismus based on patient-sourced videos of programmatic cover tests.
intervention.arm_group_label: Eligible participants for smartphone-based strabismus measurement and diagnosis

study_pop.textblock: Outpatients from strabismus & optometry departments or participants from the internet.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
The quality of facial videos should be clinically acceptable.

facility.name: Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center, Sun Yat-sen Univerisity
